title: How to Reset a Honeywell Thermostat: T9, T10, Smart WiFi 9000 & More

steps.title: Press the menu button on the screen.
steps.content: Press the menu button on the screen. It's at the bottom of the screen and has an icon of three horizontal lines.

steps.title: Select Advanced Setup.
steps.content: Select Advanced Setup . You'll have to scroll to find this option.

steps.title: Choose Reset > Factory Reset.
steps.content: Choose Reset > Factory Reset . Your thermostat will immediately begin to reset. This may take a few moments to complete.

steps.title: Press the menu button on the screen.
steps.content: Press the menu button on the screen. It's located at the bottom of the screen, and has an icon of three horizontal lines.

steps.title: Select Thermostat Information.
steps.content: Select Thermostat Information . Take note of the date code, which is a four-digit number. After writing down the date code, press the back arrow button.

steps.title: Press Installer Options.
steps.content: Press Installer Options . When prompted, enter the date code as the password.

steps.title: Press Reset > Factory Reset.
steps.content: Press Reset > Factory Reset . Your thermostat will immediately begin to reset. This may take a few moments to complete.

steps.title: Press and hold the Menu button.
steps.content: Press and hold the Menu button. You will need to hold this button for 5 to 10 seconds.

steps.title: Scroll and select Reset.
steps.content: Scroll and select Reset . Use the right arrow buttons to scroll through the options.

steps.title: Choose Factory Reset.
steps.content: Choose Factory Reset . Your thermostat will immediately begin to reset. This may take a few moments to complete.

steps.title: Press and hold the cloud button.
steps.content: Press and hold the cloud button. While you do this, press the i button repeatedly.

steps.title: Scroll and select Reset.
steps.content: Scroll and select Reset . Your thermostat will immediately begin to reset. This may take a few moments to complete.

steps.title: Press the Menu button.
steps.content: Press the Menu button. This button is in the upper-right corner. It may say Settings instead of Menu .

steps.title: Choose Preferences.
steps.content: Choose Preferences . You'll need to scroll to find this option.

steps.title: Select Restore Factory Defaults > Yes.
steps.content: Select Restore Factory Defaults > Yes . Your thermostat will immediately begin to reset. This may take a few moments to complete.

steps.title: Press the up arrow button and the fan button at the same time.
steps.content: Press the up arrow button and the fan button at the same time. You'll need to press and hold these buttons for a few seconds until you see the screen change.

steps.title: Adjust the left number to 90 and the right number to 1.
steps.content: Adjust the left number to 90 and the right number to 1. Use the buttons on the front of the thermostat to adjust the numbers.

steps.title: Press Done.
steps.content: Press Done . Your thermostat will immediately begin to reset. This may take a few moments to complete. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Press System.
steps.content: Press System . It's a button located at the top of the screen.

steps.title: Press and hold the blank box.
steps.content: Press and hold the blank box. It's located in the center of the screen.

steps.title: Adjust the numbers.
steps.content: Adjust the numbers. Change the number on the left to 0710 and the number on the right to 1 .

steps.title: Press Done.
steps.content: Press Done . Your thermostat will immediately begin to reset. This may take a few moments to complete.

steps.title: Press System.
steps.content: Press System . It's a button located at the top of the screen.

steps.title: Select Dealer Information.
steps.content: Select Dealer Information . Take note of the date code, which is a four-digit number. After writing down the date code, press the back arrow button.

steps.title: Press Installer Options.
steps.content: Press Installer Options . When prompted, enter the date code as the password.

steps.title: Press Reset > Factory Reset.
steps.content: Press Reset > Factory Reset . Your thermostat will immediately begin to reset. This may take a few moments to complete.

steps.title: Remove the thermostat from the wall.
steps.content: Remove the thermostat from the wall. To remove the thermostat from the wall, pull it away from the wall gently but firmly. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Remove the batteries from the back of the thermostat.
steps.content: Remove the batteries from the back of the thermostat. If your thermostat can be powered down, make sure to do so before removing the batteries.

steps.title: Place the batteries in the thermostat in the wrong direction.
steps.content: Place the batteries in the thermostat in the wrong direction. Leave the batteries like this for at least 10 seconds.

steps.title: Put the batteries back in the thermostat correctly.
steps.content: Put the batteries back in the thermostat correctly. Power on the thermostat, if required, and hang it back on the wall. The thermostat will be reset back to factory settings.
